Docs.summary: This is a primary interface in a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this primary interface only when the method you want to use shares the same name as an event of the COM object; in this case, cast to this interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Otherwise, use the .NET interface that is derived from the COM coclass to access methods, properties, and events of the COM object. For information about the COM object, see .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowInCellEditing { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that determines whether in-cell editing is allowed in the object. Read/write.

remarks.para: If this property is set to True, then the property of the TableView object is automatically set to olAlwaysSingleLine.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AlwaysExpandConversation { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether conversations are always fully expanded in the table view. Read/write.

remarks.para: The AlwaysExpandConversation property is analogous to selecting Always Expand Conversations in the Conversations menu of the Arrangement group on the View tab of the Microsoft Office Fluent ribbon.
True indicates that conversation groups are fully expanded in the table view by default; False indicates conversation groups are only partially expanded.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent Outlook application for the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Apply() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Applies the object to the current view.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AutoFormatRules As AutoFormatRules

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the set of formatting rules applicable to the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutomaticColumnSizing { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether the columns in the object are automatically sized by Outlook. Read/write.

remarks.para: If this property is set to False, then the property of the TableView object is automatically set to olAlwaysSingleLine.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutomaticGrouping { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether the automatic grouping is active in the object. Read/write.

remarks.para: If this property is set to True, items are automatically grouped in the view according to the arrangement specified in the Outlook user interface. If this property is set to False, items are grouped in the view according to the contents of the property.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that determines how items are automatically previewed by the object. Read/write.

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the font used when automatically previewing Outlook items in the object. Read-only.

Docs.summary: Returns an constant indicating the object's class. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ColumnFont As ViewFont

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the font used when displaying column headers in the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Filter { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) value that represents the filter for a view. Read/write.

remarks.para: The value of this property is a string, in DAV Searching and Locating (DASL) syntax, that represents the current filter for the view. For more information about using DASL syntax to filter items in a view, see Filtering Items

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.Table GetTable() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents all of the Microsoft Outlook items that are contained in a object.
Docs.returns: Returns a Tableobject whose rows represent items in the current table view.

remarks.para: The GetTable method of the TableView object returns a table of items from one or more folders in the same store or spanning over multiple stores, in an aggregated view. For example, an aggregated view obtained by a search across all mail items by using Instant Search. This behavior differs from the method of the object, which obtains a table object that contains items from the same folder.

The parent TableView object must be based on the current folder of the active explorer, as indicated by the property of the active object. If the folder is not a current folder of a visible explorer, or if the view of that folder, which is indicated by the property, is not a table view, Outlook returns an error.

The filter for the resultant table is set by the property of the TableView object. If the Filter property of the TableView object is not empty, GetTable returns a Table object with rows that represent the filtered subset of items available in the view. If subsequently, the method is called on the resultant table, applying the Restrict method is equivalent to a logical AND operation with the filter represented by .

GetTable returns a Table with the default column set. GetTable does not return a Table that contains columns for each field in the collection of the current view. For more information on the default column set of a table based on the folder type, see Default Properties Displayed in a Table Object. To modify the default column set, use the , , or methods of the collection object. Properties that you cannot add to a table as columns are listed in Unsupported Properties in a Table Object or Table Filter.

The order of rows in the resultant table is not guaranteed to be the same as the order of items in the current view on which GetTable is based. For example, GetTable does not return a table with a row that represents a group-by header in the view. To sort the rows in the table returned from GetTable, use the method of the Table object.

The parent object of the Table object returned by GetTable is the TableView object. The parent object of the TableView object is the collection, and the parent object of the Views collection is the Folder object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GoToDate([in]valuetype System.DateTime Date) runtime managed

Docs.param: The date to which the view should be changed.
Docs.summary: Changes the date used by the current view to display information.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlGridLineStyle GridLineStyle { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlGridLineStyle get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlGridLineStyle value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that represents the line style used for grid lines in the object. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property GroupByFields As OrderFields

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the set of fields by which the items displayed in the object are grouped. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HideReadingPaneHeaderInfo { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that determines whether the header for an Outlook item is displayed in the Reading Pane for the object. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Language { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) value that represents the language setting for the view. Read/write.

remarks.para: The Language property uses a String (string in C#) to represent an ISO language tag. For example, the string "EN-US" represents the ISO code for "United States - English."

If a valid language code is specified, the object will only be available in the View menu for the specified language type. If no value is specified, the object item is available for all language types. The default value for this property is an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool LockUserChanges { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether a user can modify the settings of the view. Read/write.

remarks.para: If True, the user can modify the settings of the specified view. However, changes made to the interface will not be saved. If False (the default), any changes will be saved.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxLinesInMultiLineView { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value that determines the maximum number of lines displayed in multiline mode for the object. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property can be set to a value between 2 and 20. If this property is set to a value less than 2, the property is set to 2. If this property is set to a value greater than 20, the property is set to 20. The default value for this property is 2.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlMultiLine MultiLine { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlMultiLine get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlMultiLine value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that determines how multiple lines are displayed in the object. Read/write.

remarks.para: If the value of the property is set to False or if the value of the property is set to True, the value of this property is automatically set to olAlwaysSingleLine.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MultiLineWidth { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value that represents the text width (in characters) needed to trigger multiline mode in the object . Read/write

remarks.para: This property can be set to a value between 1 and 999. If this property is set to a value less than 1, the property is set to 1. If this property is set to a value greater than 999, the property is set to 999. The default value for this property is 100.

This property only applies if the property of the TableView object is set to olWidthMultiLine. The value of this property determines the point at which the TableView object displays text for an Outlook item in multiline mode.

remarks.para: This method works only on built-in Outlook views.

remarks.para: The value of the SaveOption property is set when the object is created using the method of the collection.

remarks.para: The Session property and the method can be used interchangeably to obtain the NameSpace object for the current session. Both members serve the same purpose. For example, the following pairs of statements perform the same function:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowConversationByDate { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether items in a conversation are vertically left-aligned and ordered by the received date and time, with the most recent item on top. Read/write.

remarks.para: If the table view is not organized by conversation, setting the ShowConversationByDate property does not reorganize any items in the view. To display items by conversation, in the Conversations group of the View tab in the Microsoft Office Fluent ribbon, check Show as Conversations.

Setting the ShowConversationByDate property to True vertically left-aligns conversation items and orders them by their received date and time, with the most recent item on top. This organization in the conversation view is the same as having cleared the Use Classic Indented View setting in the Conversations Settings menu in the Conversations group of the ribbon.

Setting the ShowConversationByDate property to False indents conversation items and orders them by their received date and time with the earliest item on top. The root of each thread of the conversation is displayed first, followed by items belonging to that thread, each left-indented from the last. This organization in the conversation view is the same as having selected the Use Classic Indented View setting in the Conversations Settings menu in the Conversations group of the ribbon.

To apply a change to the ShowConversationByDate property, call the method. Conversations are then displayed as collapsed in the conversation view. If you expand a conversation, you will see items in the conversation reorganized and displayed the way you set the ShowConversationByDate property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowConversationSendersAboveSubject { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether the table view displays the participating senders above the subject line in the conversation header, or below it. Read/write.

remarks.para: True indicates that the table view displays the participating senders above the subject line in the conversation header. False indicates that the table view displays the participating senders below the subject line in the conversation header.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowFullConversations { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether to display conversation items from other folders, such as the Sent Items folder, as part of the conversation in the table view. Read/write.

remarks.para: The ShowFullConversations property takes effect only if the current table view displays items by date and conversation.

True indicates that items of the same conversation are displayed by default as part of the conversation in the table view. False indicates that only conversation items in the current folder are displayed in the table view.
The ShowFullConversations property is analogous to selecting Show Messages from Other Folders in the Conversations menu of the Arrangement group on the View tab of the Microsoft Office Fluent ribbon.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowItemsInGroups { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that determines whether Outlook items are shown in groups within the object. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowNewItemRow { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that determines if the new item row is displayed in the object. Read/write

remarks.para: The value of this property applies only if the property is set to True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowReadingPane { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether the Reading Pane is displayed in the object. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowUnreadAndFlaggedMessages { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: This object, member, or enumeration is deprecated and is not intended to be used in your code.

public: property bool Standard { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates whether the object is a built-in Outlook view. Read-only.

remarks.para: The method can only be used on a view if the value of this property is set to True.

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the set of fields with which Outlook items are displayed in the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ViewType As OlViewType

Docs.summary: Returns an constant that indicates the view type of the view. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ XML { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) value that specifies the XML definition of the view. Read/write.

remarks.para: The XML definition describes the view type by using a series of tags and keywords corresponding to various properties of the view itself. When the view is created, the XML definition is parsed to render the settings for the new view.
To determine how the XML should be structured when creating views, you can create a view by using the Outlook user interface and then you can retrieve the XML property for that view.
